title: Jun Aoyama
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Aoyama was born in <a href="Sendai">Sendai</a> on 3 January 1988. He joined <a href="Nagoya%20Grampus">Nagoya Grampus Eight</a> (later "Nagoya Grampus") from youth team in 2006. However he could hardly play in the match and he moved to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club <a href="Cerezo%20Osaka">Cerezo Osaka</a> in May 2008. He played many matches at Cerezo. He moved to <a href="Tokushima%20Vortis">Tokushima Vortis</a> in 2009 and became a regular player. In 2011, he moved to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Urawa Reds</a>. However he could hardly play in the match and he returned Vortis in 2012. He played many matches and the club was promoted to J1 League end of 2013 season. However his opportunity to play decreased and the club was relegated to J2 League in a season. He retired in July 2015.
National team career.
In July 2007, Aoyama was elected <a href="Japan%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Japan U-20 national team</a> for <a href="2007%20FIFA%20U-20%20World%20Cup">2007 U-20 World Cup</a>. At this tournament, he played 3 matches as defensive midfielder. He scored a goal for Japan in the 79th minute in Japan's win against <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Scotland</a> (3–1).
